Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, grey in section with white inclusions, the exterior is covered with cream-coloured slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, faded in parts.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393321) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393321)
